@graph.name: Maple Walnut Blueberry Crisp - A healthier blueberry crisp - Marisa Moore Nutrition
@graph.description: Wondering how to make a healthy blueberry crisp? This healthier blueberry crisp is made with oats, walnuts, and maple syrup and so easy to make!

@graph.name: Maple Blueberry Walnut Crisp
@graph.description: This healthier blueberry crisp is easy to make! It's made with oats and walnuts for crunch and sweetened with maple syrup!

video.name: Healthier Blueberry Crisp
video.description: This healthier blueberry crisp is easy to make! It's made with oats and walnuts for crunch and sweetened with maple syrup!

recipeIngredient: 4 cups fresh or thawed frozen blueberries
¼ cup chopped walnuts or pecans
2 tbsp  unsalted butter, cut into cubes

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 350°F. Prep 4 ramekins with cooking spray or butter. Place on a baking sheet lined with foil because things will get bubbly! Prep 4 ramekins with cooking spray or butter. Place on a baking sheet lined with foil.
recipeInstructions.name: Preheat the oven to 350°F. Prep 4 ramekins with cooking spray or butter. Place on a baking sheet lined with foil because things will get bubbly! Prep 4 ramekins with cooking spray or butter. Place on a baking sheet lined with foil.

recipeInstructions.text: To make the filling: Using a spoon, toss the blueberries, tapioca flour, maple syrup, and vanilla in a medium bowl. Set aside.
recipeInstructions.name: To make the filling: Using a spoon, toss the blueberries, tapioca flour, maple syrup, and vanilla in a medium bowl. Set aside.

recipeInstructions.text: To make the crumble topping: Combine oats, walnuts, brown sugar, salt,  and cinnamon. Using a pastry cutter, fork or your hands, cut the butter into the oat mixture until it takes on a crumb-like appearance.
recipeInstructions.name: To make the crumble topping: Combine oats, walnuts, brown sugar, salt,  and cinnamon. Using a pastry cutter, fork or your hands, cut the butter into the oat mixture until it takes on a crumb-like appearance.

recipeInstructions.text: Heap 1 cup of blueberries into each of the ramekins. Top each with two tablespoons of the crumble topping.
recipeInstructions.name: Heap 1 cup of blueberries into each of the ramekins. Top each with two tablespoons of the crumble topping.

recipeInstructions.text: Bake until juices bubble and the crumble topping becomes golden brown, about 30-35 minutes. Let cool slightly. Serve warm.Optional: Enjoy with a dollop of vanilla yogurt or whipped cream.
recipeInstructions.name: Bake until juices bubble and the crumble topping becomes golden brown, about 30-35 minutes. Let cool slightly. Serve warm.Optional: Enjoy with a dollop of vanilla yogurt or whipped cream.
